alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Peoria (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 20 at 5:48PM CDT until April 20 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN PEORIA AND EAST CENTRAL FULTON COUNTIES... At 547 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Peoria, Canton, Bartonville, West Peoria, Bellevue, Hanna City, Glasford, St. David, Norwood, Kingston Mines, Dunfermline, Mapleton, Bryant, Banner, Smithville and Peoria International Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
